speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Brian Cox  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}     **1:57 P.M. MANCHESTER TIME** _Scene 1 - Ray's Pub, Manchester Fade in.  The same pub Niles was thrown out of before.  Harry Moon is sitting at a table.  Niles comes in, a handkerchief over his face, and walks over to him.  Putting it away, he composes himself._

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Harry
text: You again!  Didn't I toss you out of here last night?

speaker: Niles
text: Six times.  But if you'll just give me a minute to...

speaker: Harry
text: [_rising_] Gentlemen, this lad has traveled all the way from America to reunite me with my wife. _The crowd makes ugly noises as Harry grabs Niles and prepares to toss him out yet again._

speaker: Niles
text: [_loudly_] Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait!  You never gave me a chance to buy a round of drinks! _The crowd changes its tune, calling for Niles to be let in after all. Harry drags Niles over to the bar._

speaker: Harry
text: All right, the usual, Ray.  Start talking.  You got one pint. _Ray hands him a pint and he starts drinking as Niles puts money down. He quickly consults some handwritten notes, then begins._

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, a great man once wrote that "The opposite of love is not hate, but indifference."

speaker: Harry
text: Done.  Get out!

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, Mr. Moon, your wife, your wife is miserable without you.  I think you should give her a second chance.  After all, you were married for forty years.

speaker: Harry
text: Forty years too long!  Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm late for work.

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry. _Harry walks over to a table where a young couple is sitting.  He leans over to the woman._

speaker: Harry
text: Hallo, aren't you a pretty thing?  Fancy a roll in the hay?

speaker: Man
text: No one talks to my woman that way! _He punches Harry in the stomach, leaving him doubled over and gasping in pain as Niles looks on in shock._

speaker: Man
text: [_to his girlfriend_] Let's go! _They get up and leave.  But after the woman clears the door, the man hurries back over to Harry and hands him a note._

speaker: Man
text: Here's a tenner, Harry.  Hope I didn't hurt you.

speaker: Harry
text: All in the line of duty.  Good luck to you, she's a nice bit of skirt.

speaker: Man
text: Ta. _The man heads out the door as Harry goes back to the bar.  Niles, dumbfounded, comes up behind him._

speaker: Harry
text: Same again, Ray.

speaker: Niles
text: What was that?

speaker: Harry
text: My job.  I let lads give me a thumpin' to impress their dates. I tell you it's a cake walk compared to being married to Gertrude.  At least when these lads hit me, they hold something back.

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, you wouldn't recognize your wife.  She's mellowed.

speaker: Harry
text: You're wasting your breath.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, forget about your wife for a minute. Think about your daughter.  She's heartbroken.

speaker: Harry
text: My Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, the separation is tearing her apart.  If you care about her, come back to Seattle with me and talk to your wife. If you don't patch things up, at least your only daughter will know you cared enough to try.

speaker: Harry
text: Well, you know, I'd love to see my baby girl again.  But I can't afford to travel across the Atlantic whenever I please.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I would pay for the ticket, of course.

speaker: Harry
text: I can't have you buying me a first-class ticket to America!

speaker: Niles
text: I insist!

speaker: Harry
text: All right.  For Daphne.  You know, you're lucky you caught me on a light work week.  Oh, here's my two o'clock now.

speaker: Harry
text: Hallo.  Aren't you a pretty thing? _Niles just watches this, a fascinated yet disturbed look on his face.  FADE OUT  Scene 2 - Cafe Nervosa Fade in.  Roz is sitting at a table near the counter.  Frasier gets a coffee._

speaker: Frasier
text: Mind if I join you, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please.  You can help me kill some time.  Roger's picking up his things from my apartment and I don't want to run into him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting_] Ah.  Afraid you'll fight?

speaker: Roz
text: Worse.  I'm afraid we'll end up in bed.  I don't know, there's something about him that is irresistible.

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand.

speaker: Roz
text: Trust me, you don't.  Roger is the best lover I've ever been with.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God, what am I saying?  You were great too!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, really, there's no need to do this.

speaker: Roz
text: It's just that I forgot and, well, technically it wasn't really sex because it was you, but whatever it was, it was great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, please, there's no need to discuss it.

speaker: Roz
text: I was one satisfied customer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Glad to hear it.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, here, let's pretend this comment card is about you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, please, there is no need to do that.  All right, if you insist.  Just remember that it was late at night and I am really more of a morning person.

speaker: Roz
text: [_handing it to him_] Here you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's see.  High marks for courtesy and neatness of appearance, that's good.  You were served in a prompt and timely manner.

speaker: Roz
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, I see here that you're not planning a return visit.

speaker: Roz
text: Only because we agreed.  I mean, as you can see, I will highly recommend you to friends and family members.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was very kind of you, Roz, thank you.  Would you like me to fill one out for you?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  I think you made your opinion clear when you screamed "Outstanding!"  _Frasier laughs self-consciously.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Frasier and Niles come in the front with Harry._

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, thanks for a tour of your city, lads.  Now, where's your loo?  I need to splash me boots. _Frasier opens the door to the powder room and Harry goes in.  Frasier gives Niles a look._

speaker: Niles
text: It's just an expression.  Or so I've chosen to believe. _He takes off his coat and hangs it up.  Frasier goes to sit on the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, are you and Daphne planning on having children?

speaker: Niles
text: Someday, why?

speaker: Frasier
text: No reason.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, all I have to do is stash Mr. Moon at my place, pick up Daphne and her mom at the airport, then get them all together, and lay the groundwork for a reconciliation.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Dad.  How was work?

speaker: Martin
text: Great.  I finally busted that guy who was writing "Seymour Buttes" on the sign-out sheets.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, who was it?

speaker: Martin
text: Senior Vice-President Buttes.  I'm on probation for a week.

speaker: Harry
text: Good God, you American police are persistent. [_He pulls something from his pocket._] I suppose you're looking for this.

speaker: Martin
text: [_taking it, confused_] A Space Needle snow globe?

speaker: Harry
text: I meant to pay for it.  I put it in me pocket, but between there and the register, I forgot about it.  Why don't you take it back?

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, I think you're mistaken.  This is our father, he works as a security guard.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Marty Crane.  How do you do?

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, Harold Moon.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, you did a terrific job bringing up your daughter.

speaker: Harry
text: Well, you know, you do your best.  I'll be needing that back, then.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Harry, let me get you a beer.

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, get a man a beer, he drinks for five minutes; teach 'im where they are, he drinks all day.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad, Dad, I need you to do me a favor.  Mr. Moon is a little bit reluctant about getting back together with his wife.

speaker: Martin
text: Huh, can you blame him?

speaker: Niles
text: It occurs to me, there's no woman so attractive than the one some other guy seems to be attracted to.  So...

speaker: Martin
text: No way!

speaker: Niles
text: But-but-but-but... it would mean a lot to Daphne.  And, it'll get Mrs. Moon out of the country.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if it means a lot to Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she's a hell of a woman, your Gertrude.  I don't blame you for comin' over here to fight for her.

speaker: Harry
text: Really?  What's so great about her?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know.  I mean, like I have to tell you...  The whole package.  She's got... hair... skin...  Et cetera.  And she's a good little drinker.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, Dad, why just last week you were commenting on her twinkly eyes and her sunny smile.

speaker: Martin
text: Definitely.  Yes, I was.  Yeah they sure don't make women like that in America. [_to Eddie_] Come on, boy.

speaker: Harry
text: Wait a minute.  I think I know what's goin' on here.  The dog, the cane...  He's lost his vision, hasn't he?  _Frasier can only nod in defeat.  FADE TO:  Scene 4 - Niles' Apartment Fade in.  Gertrude Moon, Daphne and Niles come in the front.  Gertrude sits on the couch, still talking._

speaker: Gertrude
text: And then, she drags me to another luau.  Where I come from, you bury a dead pig because it's diseased, not because you're going to dig it up and eat it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, Hawaii's not for everyone.  Things may be looking up.  I have a surprise.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, a surprise.  I hope it's not another trip, darling, or I might just have to kill you in your sleep. _Harry shouts from the other room then rushes to the landing holding a pair of Niles' shoes._

speaker: Harry
text: Niles, good news!  Our feet are the same size!

speaker: Daphne
text: Daddy!  I knew you'd come!

speaker: Harry
text: Hello, Stilts!  Ah, give your old dad a kiss!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, look who's here, all the way from England!

speaker: Harry
text: Hallo, Gert.

speaker: Gertrude
text: "Hallo, Gert"?  That's all you have to say for yourself? For forty years I've been a good wife to you, raising your children and boiling your meals and letting you work off your animal lusts and all I get for my trouble is a cheery "Hallo, Gert"?!  Well your fatal charm is not going to work this time, so you can just drag your sorry arse back to that barstool it normally sags over and leave me the hell alone!

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_cheerily_] Thank you, Niles, that was a nice surprise.

speaker: Harry
text: You're right.  She has mellowed.

speaker: Daphne
text: See?  And I'm sure if you just give her a little more time, everything will work out.

speaker: Harry
text: I gave it me best shot.  I'm going to go pack.

speaker: Daphne
text: Daddy...

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't understand.  He came all this way and he's just going to give up?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually, he didn't even want to come.  I sort of... flew to England and persuaded him.

speaker: Daphne
text: You what?

speaker: Niles
text: I wanted to surprise you.

speaker: Daphne
text: How could you do this without talking to me first?

speaker: Niles
text: That would've spoiled the surprise?

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, I could have flown to England and talked to him, too, but I didn't because I know my parents.  When they fight they need time apart to miss each other.  And you would have known that had you consulted me first! _She heads off to the guest room to see her mother.  Harry comes from upstairs, stopping to pick up Niles' shoes._

speaker: Harry
text: I'm off.

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, Mr. Moon, wait.  Just stay one more day and spend a little more time with your daughter.  I'll put you up in a hotel.

speaker: Harry
text: I can't let you buy me a suite in a five-star hotel!  _Niles again notices the extravagance, but leads him off.  FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 -- Cafe Nervosa Fade in.  Niles is sitting and drinking coffee, but jumps up when Daphne comes in._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry I yelled at you last night.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I'm sorry.  I, I was thinking about it, you were absolutely right.  We're a team now and bringing your dad back should have been our joint decision.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks for understanding.  Anyway, what's done is done.  Mum's taken her claws out of the ceiling and Dad's headed back to England.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I convinced him to stay an extra day.  I thought I should tell you since we're a team.

speaker: Daphne
text: You what?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought you'd want to spend more time with him, plus, since they're both in the same city, we can get them together tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Or not.  We're a team!  Totally up to you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know, maybe we should let them work it out for themselves.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, or on the other hand maybe our love will inspire them and come October, they'll be dancing at our wedding.

speaker: Daphne
text: That would be wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier, listen: Daphne and I are taking her parents out to dinner tonight.  Can you get a reservation at Chez Henri?

speaker: Frasier
text: Chez Henri?  Niles, they're booked up months in advance.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I know that I wouldn't stand a chance, but I was hoping if I cloaked myself in the mantle your greater renown...

speaker: Frasier
text: You should know better than that, Niles, I am NOT susceptible to flattery.

speaker: Niles
text: I know that.  You're the most grounded, down-to-earth person I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  I'll make a call.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey, Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, Roz.  I wanted to talk to you about this.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God, you still have that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I was glancing at it.  I couldn't help but notice the overall score you gave me: out of a possible five cups of coffee, it was a four.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's a good score.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a fine score.  But it occurs to me that this presents an opportunity for me to learn something about my performance that might... benefit me.  So, what might I have done to earn that elusive fifth cup?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'm a tough grader.  No one's a five-cupper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nonetheless, there is a theoretical fifth cup out there. Now, I'm going to put ego aside, this is all about self- improvement.  My commitment to "sexcellence" if you will.

speaker: Roz
text: You just lost a cup.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: All right.  Um, you know that thing you did at the end?

speaker: Frasier
text: At the very end?

speaker: Roz
text: Just before.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know exactly what you mean.

speaker: Roz
text: I coulda done without that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  You didn't like that.  Well maybe that's just your taste.

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: 'Cause I've received high kudos for that in the past.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, don't take it personally.  It would have been impossible for either one of us to get a perfect score that night, given the circumstances.  We were both tentative, and more than a little vulnerable.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's true.

speaker: Roz
text: And it was tough to concentrate with the TV blaring away in your dad's bedroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't hear that.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't you remember?  Sting was on Letterman.  He was talking about the rain forest and the plight of the Yanomama Indians. It was really sad.   I mean, the whole Orinoco River Valley is being forested into extinction.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... I'm glad my woefully inadequate performance didn't distract you from your ecology lesson.  Did Sting happen to mention anything about you shaving your legs?  Because that's a rain forest that could use some pruning!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!  That is exactly why I didn't want to do this! Forget it. _She grabs the card and tears it up.  Frasier looks embarrassed. They sit in silence for a few moments.  Roz smiles._

speaker: Roz
text: You know, you're a very good kisser.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not.  You are, I'm not.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, you are.  Do I need to fill out another card?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please! [_his expression turns hopeful_] Would you?  _She grabs a pencil and starts.  FADE TO:  Scene 2 - Chez Henri Fade in.  Niles, Daphne, Gertrude and Harry come to a table, led by the owner._

speaker: Henri
text: We have some magnificent specials this evening.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_as they sit_] Just so you know, Henry, I won't eat frogs, snails, slugs or eels.  And don't try slippin' 'em under the sauce.  I'm on to you people.

speaker: Henri
text: I shall repeat this to the chef and I'm sure some other delightful surprise will find its way onto your plate.

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't this lovely?  Candlelight, romantic music.  Must take you back to the days of your courtship.  Where did you two meet?

speaker: Harry
text: At a soccer riot.  She stopped a Spanish bloke from smashin' a chair over me head.

speaker: Gertrude
text: He wasn't Spanish, he was Portuguese.

speaker: Harry
text: I believe he was Spanish.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well I believe I know the difference between a bloody Spaniard and a bloody Portuguese!

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, okay, moving on... Your first date?

speaker: Harry
text: She had me over for dinner.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, do you remember, I cooked you bubble and squeak.

speaker: Harry
text: And then we went out, got squiffy and half starkers and snogged behind the chippy.

speaker: Niles
text: You lost me after the word "dinner," but the language of love is universal.  [_N.B. "bubble and squeak" - a dish of leftover potatoes and vegetables, fried up; "squiffy" - drunk or tipsy._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Listen, we had some good times back then, hey?

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, you should have seen her, Daphne, she was a real firecracker.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] Maybe we should order some champagne.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I brought a very special bottle from home.  It's in the car. [_getting up_] You two, you just keep reminiscing, I'll be right back.  _He hurries out.  CUT TO: the front of the restaurant as he runs along to his car. He comes across a man walking his dog._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, lovely dog. _The dog gets very friendly with Niles' leg for a moment.  Niles pushes him off and hits the remote for his trunk.  He grabs a bottle of wine, closes the trunk and hurries back into the restaurant.  CUT TO: the dining area, where he finds a small fire started on the floor, table and chairs overturned, Daphne holding back Gertrude and a waiter holding back Harry.  Needless to say, there is a lot of shouting going on._

speaker: Gertrude
text: Take that back!

speaker: Harry
text: I will not!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mummy, Daddy, please!

speaker: Niles
text: What happened to snogging behind the chippy?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Get out of my country!

speaker: Harry
text: I can't leave soon enough!

speaker: Harry
text: You're Martin Crane's problem now.

speaker: Gertrude
text: What?

speaker: Harry
text: Did you think I wouldn't find out about your little fancy man?  He says he can't stop thinkin' about ya!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, that's because he knows a good thing when he sees it!

speaker: Harry
text: He can't see anything!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Take me home, Daphne.  I've had enough of this horrid man!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait!  Now that the lines of communication are open...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, leave it alone Niles!  Come on, Mum.... _They leave as Niles turns to survey the damage of the evening.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin is on the phone._

speaker: Martin
text: No, Gertrude, I never said I had a thing for you... No, I'm not playing hard to get... Yes, I guess if I was playing hard to get, I'd say that I wasn't, but I'm not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Henri, you can't ban me from your bistro!  It's my chez away from chez! ...Very well.  Goodbye, Henri.

speaker: Martin
text: Goodbye, Gertrude.

speaker: Martin
text: Great, I cheated death in Korea for this!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_darkly_] Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: I see word travels fast.

speaker: Harry
text: Is Daphne here?

speaker: Martin
text: No, she's not back from taking her mother home.

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, well... I was hoping to see her before I left.  I guess I'll leave her a note, then.

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Moon, I'm sorry I dragged you all the way to America.

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, it wasn't all that bad.  I got to see Daphne.  And that hotel was brilliant!  The towels were so fluffy I could barely close me suitcase.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm sorry things didn't work out.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she can't say you didn't try.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, Dad, why don't we go into your bedroom?  I want to show you how to use the closed captioning on your TV so you won't have to have it up so loud at night.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Niles
text: Your dad's here in your room, leaving you a note.  How's your mom?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sitting on the couch_] Apparently there's nothing left for her in England, so she's thinking about putting down roots here.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, from the bottom of my heart...

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, it's been a very trying day.  Could we talk about this later?  I'll drive Daddy to the airport.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll move his suitcase to your car.

speaker: Harry
text: There you are.  Well, back to England, then.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  No chance of you and Mum getting back together?

speaker: Harry
text: Don't think so, love.  Not this time.

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe if you give it another chance.  You could...

speaker: Harry
text: Daphne - I'm sorry.  It's over.  Has been for a long time! I mean, I've got no complaints, I got something wonderful out of it: you!

speaker: Daphne
text: If you don't love each other, why did you stay together for forty years?  Through all the fighting and the screaming and the hitting?

speaker: Harry
text: That was for you kids.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't believe this is really happening.  I mean, maybe I'm naive, but I always thought love would save the day.

speaker: Harry
text: Well, you know, we all think that when we're young.  But then life beats us around a bit and you learn to dream a little smaller.

speaker: Daphne
text: So that's how it goes: two people meet, they're together for forty years, and then all of a sudden it just ends.

speaker: Harry
text: But it's different from you!  I mean, you've found the right person.

speaker: Daphne
text: You barely know him.

speaker: Harry
text: Well, all I know is, I threw him out of my pub six times and six times he marched back in and yammered me ear off until, until I went back with him to America - all to make YOU happy. I never did anything like that for your mother.  No no, I tell ya, Daphne, you've got the right one there.  A good one, you know?  And another thing: [_rubs his fingers together_] He's worth a bob or two.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dad!

speaker: Harry
text: Oh, sweetie...  _They hug again.  FADE TO:  Scene 4 - Niles' Apartment Fade in.  There is a knocking at the front door.  Niles answers it to reveal Daphne._

speaker: Daphne
text: I want to marry you!

speaker: Niles
text: I want to marry you!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I want to marry you NOW!

speaker: Niles
text: As in... now?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: Why?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why?  Because you'd do anything, even put up with my insane family, to make me happy.  Because you'd travel halfway around the world to make my dreams come true, even the impossible ones.  And because I can't spend one more minute without being your wife, Niles Crane.  Because I adore you.

speaker: Niles
text: But... I thought you always wanted a big wedding.
